model_metrics.py¶

class model_metrics.ModelMetrics(classifier, y, y_pred, y_prob, option)¶

An instance of this class stores information about a classifier’s performance metrics with respect to training, validation or test set.

Variables:
  • classes_ (list) – valid classes for the classification problem
  • num_classes_ (int) – total number of valid classes
  • accuracy_ (float) – accuracy of the classifier
  • avg_precision_ (float) – average precision over all classes
  • avg_recall_ (float) – average recall over all classes
  • avg_f1_ (float) – average f1 score over all classes
  • avg_auroc_ (float) – average AUROC over all classes
  • avg_auprc_ (float) – average AUPRC over all classes
  • confusion_matrix_ (2D array) – confusion matrix in percents

The dictionaries below use class names as keys. Each value in the dictionaries is a floating-point number.

Variables:
  • class_precision_ (dict) – classwise precisions
  • class_recall_ (dict) – classwise recalls
  • class_f1_ (dict) – classwise f1 scores
  • class_auroc_ (dict) – classwise AUROCs
  • class_auprc_ (dict) – classwise AUPRCs

The dictionaries below use class names and ‘avg’ as keys. Each value in the dictionaries is a list of metric values at different decision threshold.

Variables:
  • fpr_ (dict) – FPRs for plotting all ROC curves
  • tpr_ (dict) – TPRs for plotting all ROC curves
  • precision_ (dict) – precisions for plotting all PR curves
  • recall_ (dict) – recalls for plotting all PR curves
__init__(classifier, y, y_pred, y_prob, option)¶

Construct a new instance of the class.

Parameters:
  • classifier (sklearn classifier object) – classifier for evaluation
  • y (pandas series) – true labels
  • y_pred (pandas series) – predicted labels
  • y_prob (pandas dataframe) – classwise probabilities
  • option (str) – specification of evaluation method (“holdout”, “cv” or “loo”)
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

accuracy()¶

Return accuracy of the classifier.

auprc(option='average')¶

Return AUPRC of the classifier.

Parameters:option (str) – ‘average’ or ‘classwise’
auroc(option='average')¶

Return AUROC of the classifier.

Parameters:option (str) – ‘average’ or ‘classwise’
class_summary(parent, class_metric)¶

Return a summary of metrics with respect of each class.

Parameters:
  • parent (QTreeWidgetItem) – the parent node in the tree view
  • class_metric (dict) – the classwise values of a particular metric
f1(option='average')¶

Return f1 score of the classifier.

Parameters:option (str) – ‘average’ or ‘classwise’
plot_ROC(canvas)¶

Plot ROC curves. This includes all classwise curves and a macro-averaged curve.

Reference:
http://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/model_selection/plot_roc.html
Parameters:canvas (FigureCanvas) – the canvas where the plot is drawn
plot_confusion_matrix(canvas)¶

Plot confusion matrix. The entries are normalized to lie between 0 and 1.

Reference:
http://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/model_selection/plot_confusion_matrix.html
Parameters:canvas (FigureCanva) – the canvas where the plot is drawn
plot_precision_recall(canvas)¶

Plot precision-recall curves. This includes all classwise curves and a macro-averaged curve.

Reference:
http://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/model_selection/plot_precision_recall.html
Parameters:canvas (FigureCanva) – the canvas where the plot is drawn
precision(option='average')¶

Return precision of the classifier.

Parameters:option (str) – ‘average’ or ‘classwise’
recall(option='average')¶

Return recall of the classifier.

Parameters:option (str) – ‘average’ or ‘classwise’
summary(parent)¶

Display a summary of performance metrics in a tree view.

Parameters:parent (QTreeWidget) – the widget where the summary is displayed
